What's JSON: JSON, or Javascript Object Notation, is a text-based format for representing structured data based on Javascript object syntax. JSON exists as a string and, therefore, needs to be converted to a Javascript object when you want to use the data.

How do I access JSON file in my code?.Explanation of fetch(JSON File): fetch(JSON FILE) fetches the JSON file

How do I access JSON file in my code?.Explanation of .json(): .json() takes JSON file as an input and outputs a Javascript Object

What's JSON.parse() and JSON.stringify(): JSON.parse() means turning data from string to Javascript Object
JSON.stringify() means turning data from Javascript Object to String
